com.centrify.cloud.saas
Class CentrifySamlFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.centrify.cloud.saas.CentrifySamlFactory

public class CentrifySamlFactory
extends java.lang.Object

A factory class to create ISamlResponseValidator and ISamlRequestGenerator from metadata. In order to validate a SAML response, you need the public key corresponding to the private key with which the response was signed. Rather than downloading the certificate and extracting the public key, you can download the SAML metadata and use the CentrifySamlFactory class to generate request generator and response validator objects.

Constructor Detail

CentrifySamlFactory

public CentrifySamlFactory(java.net.URL idpMetadataUrl,
                           java.lang.String idpIssuerName,
                           java.lang.String spIssuerName,
                           java.lang.String spAudience)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           InvalidSamlFormatException,
                           java.security.cert.CertificateException
Constructor for the CentrifySamlFactory class.

Parameters:
idpMetadataUrl - The SAML identity provider (IdP) metadata URL. This can be the URL of a file in the local file system containing the metadata, the URL of a jar file containing the metadata, or a web URL that does not require authentication to download the metadata. For the Centrify cloud service, you can download the metadata by opening a browser, logging into the Centrify management portal, navigate to the application's setting page, and click on the "Download SAML metadata" link. Or, you can use the CentrifySaasService class which logs into Centrify mangement portal and downloads the metadata for you.
idpIssuerName - The IdP issuer name, used for validating the SAML response. This name is the contents of the Issuer field of the Application Settings tab for the application in Centrify Cloud Manager. This string is case sensitive. If this parameter is missing or null, the constructor gets the IdP issuer name from the metadata.
spIssuerName - The service provider (SP) issuer name. This is used to generate the authentication request for SP-initiated single sign-on. It can be any string, but is usually a URL.
spAudience - The SP audience, used for validating the SAML response. This should be the URL where the response is received. The audience is in the SAML assertion script in the Advanced tab for the application in Centrify Cloud Manager.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An I/O operation failed or was interrupted.
InvalidSamlFormatException - The metadata is not in a valid format.
java.security.cert.CertificateException - The metadata does not contain a valid certificate.

CentrifySamlFactory

public CentrifySamlFactory(java.net.URL idpMetadataUrl,
                           java.lang.String spIssuerName,
                           java.lang.String spAudience)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           InvalidSamlFormatException,
                           java.security.cert.CertificateException
Constructor for the CentrifySamlFactory class. The IdP issuer name will be extracted from the entity id in the metadata.

Parameters:
idpMetadataUrl - The SAML identity provider (IdP) metadata URL. This can be the URL of a file in the local file system containing the metadata, the URL of a jar file containing the metadata, or a web URL that does not require authentication to download the metadata. For the Centrify cloud service, you can download the metadata by opening a browser, logging into the Centrify management portal, navigate to the application's setting page, and click on the "Download SAML metadata" link. Or, you can use the CentrifySaasService class which logs into Centrify mangement portal and downloads the metadata for you.
spIssuerName - The service provider (SP) issuer name. This is used to generate the authentication request for SP-initiated single sign-on. It can be any string, but is usually a URL.
spAudience - The SP audience, used for validating the SAML response. This should be the URL where the response is received. The audience is in the SAML assertion script in the Advanced tab for the application in Centrify Cloud Manager.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An I/O operation failed or was interrupted.
InvalidSamlFormatException - The metadata is not in a valid format.
java.security.cert.CertificateException - The metadata doesn't contain a valid certificate.

CentrifySamlFactory

public CentrifySamlFactory(java.lang.String idpMetadataXml,
                           java.lang.String idpIssuerName,
                           java.lang.String spIssuerName,
                           java.lang.String spAudience)
                    throws InvalidSamlFormatException,
                           java.security.cert.CertificateException
Constructor for the CentrifySamlFactory class.

Parameters:
idpMetadataXml - The IdP metadata in XML format. You can use the CentrifySaasService.getSAMLMetadataForApp(String) method to get the metadata.
idpIssuerName - The IdP issuer name, used for validating the SAML response. This name is the contents of the Issuer field of the Application Settings tab for the application in Centrify Cloud Manager. This string is case sensitive. If this parameter is missing or null, the constructor gets the IdP issuer name from the metadata.
spIssuerName - The service provider (SP) issuer name. This is used to generate the authentication request for SP-initiated single sign-on. It can be any string, but is usually a URL.
spAudience - The SP audience, used for validating the SAML response. This should be the URL where the response is received. The audience is in the SAML assertion script in the Advanced tab for the application in Centrify Cloud Manager.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An I/O operation failed or was interrupted.
InvalidSamlFormatException - The metadata is not in a valid format.
java.security.cert.CertificateException - The metadata doesn't contain a valid certificate.

spIssuerName - The service provider (SP) issuer name. This is used to generate the authentication request for SP-initiated single sign-on. It can be any string, but is usually a URL.
spAudience - The SP audience, used for validating the SAML response. This should be the URL where the response is received. The audience is in the SAML assertion script in the Advanced tab for the application in Centrify Cloud Manager.

Method Detail

getResponseValidator

public ISamlResponseValidator getResponseValidator()
Returns a ISamlResponseValidator for validating SAML Responses. When you receive a SAML authentication response, you need to make sure the signature is valid and parse the response so you can extract any user attributes that you need in order to log in the user. You can use the SamlResponseValidatorobject returned by this method to validate the signature and parse the response.

Returns:
A processor you can use to generate a SAML authentication request validator.

getRequestGenerator

public ISamlRequestGenerator getRequestGenerator()
Returns a ISamlRequestGenerator class that generates SAML authentication requests (AuthnRequest)

Returns:
A processor you can use to generate a SAML authentication request.

getIdpPostUrl

public java.lang.String getIdpPostUrl()
Returns the Identity Provider's sign-in Url in the SAML metadata given in the CentrifySAMLFactory constructor.

Returns:
The identify provider (IdP) sign-in URL; this is the sign-in Url in the Idp metadata given in the CentrifySamlFactory constructor.

getCertificate

public java.security.cert.X509Certificate getCertificate()
Returns the X509 certificate contained in the SAML metadata. You can use this method to extract the certificate from the SAML metadata. This certificate contains the public key corresponding to the private key used to sign the SAML response. You can also download this certificate from the application's page in Centrify Cloud Manager.

Returns:
The X509 certificate.
